summary: a subspecies of the feline parvovirus (FPV) contains a single-stranded negative sense DNA genome of about 5 kb, with 2 main open reading frames (ORFs) the virus causes a highly infectious acute disease and has a high rate of morbidity and mortality in mink [2]–[4] due to the genetic variability of the virus these vaccines are becoming increasingly inadequate. miR-323, miR-491 and miR-654 from both 293T and MDCK cells target the same region in H1N1 influenza virus PB1 mRNAs. miR-BART2 decreases replication of EB virus by targeting viral DNA polymerase BALF5. cytomegalovirus (HCMV)-encoding miR-US25-1c blocks the cell cycle at the G1/S phase by down regulating cyclin E2, BRCC3, EID the whole viral genome which is highly homologous with MEV strain Abashiri has been sequenced in our laboratory. three cultures of uninfected cells in 6-well plates (Costar) were infected with MEV at an input multiplicity of 1 pfu/cell. tools were also used to predict regular RNAs on MEV mRNAs. target sequence was searched using BLAST (http://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi) target sequence was searched using pRL-TK (Promega) pcDNA3.1/myc-His A vector (Invitrogen) was sequenced to ensure correct insertion. pBM/rMEV was mutated using pBluescript II SK(+) Mutant. the products were digested with 1 l Dpn-1 for 1 h at 37°C to remove the parental DNA. the remaining DNA was used to transform competent DH5 cells. the mutant plasmids were obtained and confirmed by sequencing. miR-181c mimics anti-sense: 5′-UCACCGACAGGUUGAAUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGUGU mut pGL3-181t (0.1 g/well) and pRL-TK vector (0.1 g/well) were co-transfected to verify accuracy of seed sequence. NC mimics and NC inhibitors were used as negative controls. after 36 h, the cells were harvested for relative luciferase activity assay. luciferase expression was calculated as the expression of firefly luciferase (pGL3-control vector) divided by that of Renilla luciferase (pRL-TK) total cellular RNA was extracted and digested with DNase I (Takara) PCR amplication of a fragment of viral genomic DNA was carried out. total RNA was prepared and digested with DNase I (Takara) two g total RNA was reverse transcribed using M-MLV reverse transcriptase. level of -actin mRNA measured as a control. a single mammalian cell contains 14.1 pg [33] or 25 pg [34] total RNA. miRNA copies/cell could be estimated using the qPCR method. the data were analyzed by the Ct method [35] -26b CGCGTTCAAGTAATTCAGGATAGGTA GCGAGCACAGAATTAATACGACTCAC miR-29a CGTAGCACCATCTGATGTTG GCGAGCACAGAATTAATACGACTCAC miR-29b CGTAGCACCATCTGAGTTA GCGAGCACAGAATTAATACGACTCAC miR-125b TCCCTGAGACCACCATCTGAGTTA. F81 cells were infected with MEV (MOI = 0.1) after 36 h, the cells were washed 3 times with PBS. cells were then washed 3 times with PBS, incubated with fluorescein isothiocyanate (FITC)-conjugated goat anti-rabbit IgG antibody. cipitation assay human argonaute 2 antibody (Abnova) was bound to protein A/G-Agarose (Abmart) in PBS for 30 min at 4°C. RNA binding to the Ago2 protein was extracted with Trizol reagent (Invitrogen), then reverse transcribed into cDNA. NS1 and miR-181b were quantified by qPCR analysis. the whole viral genome which is homologous with MEV strain Abashiri has been sequenced in our laboratory. three cultures of uninfected cells in 6-well plates (Costar) were infected with MEV at an input multiplicity (MOI) of 1 pfu/cell. tools were used to predict miRNA targets in known genes. target sequence was searched using BLAST (http://blast.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Blast.cgi) target sequence was searched using pRL-TK (Promega) as control. mutant segment containing a tetranucleotide mutation was cloned into the pGL3-control vector to produce mut pGL3-181t. for western blot assays, the coding region of the MEV NS1 protein gene fragment was amplified by PCR using the MEV genome as a template. for this cloning, BamH I and Age I restriction sites were added to the 5′-(5′-CG the products were digested with 1 l Dpn-1 for 1 h at 37°C to remove the parental DNA. the remaining DNA was used to transform competent DH5 cells. the mutant plasmids were obtained and confirmed by sequencing (Shanghai Sangong Co.) CCACCGACAGCAAUGAAUGUUUU-3′ miR-181c mimics sense: 5′-AACAUUCAACCUGUGUCGGUGAGU-3′ miR-181d mimics anti-sense: 5′-CCACCGACAGCAAUGAAUGUUUUU-3′ miR-181d mimics sense: 5′-CCACCGACAGCAAUGAAUGUUUUU-3′ Mut-1 miR-181b mimics sense: cells at 60–70% confluence were co-transfected with a mixture of pGL3-181t and pRL-TK vector. the mut pGL3-181t vector and pRL-TK vector were co-transfected. the cells were harvested for relative luciferase activity assay. luciferase assays were performed using the dual-luciferase reporter assay system kit (Promega) luciferase activity was calculated as the expression of firefly luciferase (pGL3-control vector) divided by that of Renilla luciferase (pRL-TK) to determine the quantitative level of viral genomic DNA in F81 cells, total DNA was prepared and the concentration was measured. to detect the level of expression of NS1 mRNA transcribed from pcDNA-NS1 vector, total RNA was prepared and digested with DNase I (Takara) the expression of U6 small RNA was measured as a control using the primers 5′-CTCGCTTCGGCAGCACA-3′ and 5′-AACGCTTCACGAATTTGCGT-3′. for absolute qPCR, serial 10-fold synthetic mimics dilutions were used to generate standard curves. miRNA copies/cell could be estimated. ACTCAC miR-301a CGCAGTGCAATAGTGTCAAAGC GCGAGAGAATTAATACGACTCAC miR-26a CGGTTCAATCCAGGATAGGCT GCGAGAGAATTAATACGACTCAC miR-21. the cells were collected and washed 3 times with cold PBS. the PBS was decanted, and then 100 l RIPA lysis buffer (HX-BIO) and 0.5mM PSMF the membranes were incubated for 1 h with the appropriate horseradish peroxidase-conjugated secondary antibody (MBL: 1100 dilution) at a 15,000 dilution in TBST. protein bands were visualized and analyzed using ImageJ software. nonspecific rabbit polyclonal antibody (iso) was used as an isotype control. RNA-induced Silencing Complex (RISC) was bound to protein A/G-Agarose (Abmart) in PBS for 30 min at 4°C. RNAhybrid and RegRNA tools were used to predict miRNA target sites on MEV mRNAs. results indicated that 8 of such miRNAs might target MEV mRNAs. miR-181b showed comparatively the highest level expression (Table 2). miRNAs Rds numa in mockinfected cells Rds num in MEVinfected cells TPMb in mockinfected cells TPMb in MEVinfected cells miR-130a 72 332 12.67 59.23 miR-130b 264 584 46.44 104.18 miR-148a 510 163 89.72 29.08 miR-362 857 149 150.77 26.58 miR-454 76 1 the whole genome sequence of MEV in our lab is unpublished. c All the isolates of canine panleukopenia virus from NCBI. target site in the 3′UTR of BCL-2 is conserved in different species, including cat (black box; Figure S1 B) the analysis of TfR was carried out using TargetScan tools. results showed that, compared with TfR, BCL-2 expression level was significantly down regulated by miR-181b mimics, while the inhibitors restored the function of the endogenous miR-181b. miR-181d mimics, like miR-181b mimics, could inhibit MEV growth. but restoration of the endogenous miR-181d function by miR-181d inhibitors was not detected. flow cytometry, CPE and MEV indirect immunofluorescence assays were carried out at that time. cells were collected at the indicated times and assayed. qPCR was used to assess the effects of miR-181b mimics and inhibitors of MEV genomic DNA at the indicated times. miR-181c mimics did not affect the relative luciferase activity of mut pGL3-181t. mut-1 miR-181b mimics and inhibitors were synthesized after co-transfection. mut-1 miR-181b mimics did down regulate it by more than 2-fold. cellular miR-181b directly targets MEV NS1 coding region. target and tetranucleotide mutant target segment was cloned into pGL3-control reporter vector. mut pGL3-181t, mut-1 miR-181b mimics and inhibitors were used as controls. mut pcDNA3.1-NS1 and miR-181b mimics or inhibitors were used to co-transfect F81 cells. at 36 h post-transfection, RIPA lysis buffer (HX-BIO) was added. protein lysates were harvested and subjected to western blot assay. mut pcDNA3.1-NS1 and mut-2 miR-181b mimics were used to co-transfect F81 cells. results showed that mut NS1 expression level was significantly down regulated by more than 50% by the mut-2 miR-181b mimics. miR-181c and miR-181d were also tested for their ability to attenuate NS1 protein expression. mut pcDNA-NS1 was used instead of pcDNA-NS1. mut-2 miR-181b mimics with NC mimics as control. data are from 3 independent experiments (mean SD) mut-2 miR-181b mimics significantly decreased it by almost 2-fold. mut-2 miR-181b mimics decreased this by comparison with NC mimics. mut-2 miR-181b mimics decreased this by comparison with NC mimics. F81 cells upon infection with mut MEV from B were detected by flow cytometric analysis at 36 h post MEV infection. nonspecific rabbit polyclonal antibody (iso) as an isotype control. both cellular endogenous miR-181b and exogenous transfected miR-181b mimics physically bind to MEV NS1 mRNA in the RISC. results confirm that both cellular endogenous miR-181b and exogenous transfected miR-181b mimics physically bind to MEV NS1 mRNA in the RISC. miR-29b and miR-125b significantly increased by over 30%. qPCR was used to detect expression levels of miR-181b at 0 h, 6 h, 12 h, 24 h and 36 h after MEV infection. RNAhybrid and RegRNA tools were used to predict miRNA target sites on MEV mRNAs. results indicated that 8 of such miRNAs might target MEV mRNAs. results indicated that miR-181b showed comparatively the highest level expression. the conserved binding sites of miR-181b in the NS1 gene of pavovirus strains a. aaaatgtctt ttgtttct ttgtttctaa aaatatagaa ccaaatgaat gtgttggtt. the whole genome sequence of MEV in our lab is unpublished. the whole genome sequence of MEV in our lab is unpublished. the whole genome sequence of MEV in our lab is unpublished. miR-181b mimics inhibited viral growth and this was most evident 36 h post MEV infection. by 36 h inhibition was almost 3-fold, while the miR-181b inhibitors did not show any effect at earlier timepoints of MEV infection. by 36 h post infection, the level of the genomic DNA had increased 25% as compared with transfection by NC inhibitors. miR-181b mimics significantly reduced MEV-induced CPE in F81 cells compared with NC mimics. miR-181b mimics decreased, and miR-181b inhibitors increased the quantity of fluorescence. F81 cells upon infection with MEV from A were detected through flow cytometric analysis at 36 h post MEV infection. nonspecific rabbit polyclonal antibody (iso) as an isotype control. seed reporter vector, mut pGL3-181t, with a mutated tetranucleotide was constructed. the corresponding mut-1 miR-181b mimics and inhibitors were synthesized. mut-1 miR-181b mimics did down regulate it by more than 2-fold. the target and tetranucleotide mutant target segment was cloned into pGL3-control reporter vector. mut pGL3-181t, mut-1 miR-181b mimics and inhibitors were used for transfection. protein lysates were harvested and subjected to western blot assay. results showed that miR-181b significantly decreased NS1 protein levels by almost 40%. however, NS1 mRNA was unaffected by either miR-181b mimics or inhibitors at 36 h post-transfection. miR-181c and miR-181d were also tested for their ability to attenuate NS1 protein expression. cellular miR-181b inhibits MEV NS1 expression resulting in translational repression through targeting the predicted site of MEV NS1 mRNA. cellular miR-181b Inhibits MEV Replication through Targeting the Predicted Site of MEV NS1 mRNA To further confirm the significance of target sequence in virus production, mut pBM/rMEV was constructed. the nucleotide, but not the amino acid, sequence of the target was altered. mut-2 miR-181b but not miR-181b mimics decreased the quantity of fluorescence (Figure 5H, I ). cellular miR-181b inhibits MEV replication through targeting the predicted site of MEV NS1 mRNA. cellular miR-181b Physically Binds to MEV NS1 mRNA in the RISC. anti-Ago2 antibody was used to test if miR-181b and NS1 mRNA were enriched by Ago2. qPCR analysis of relative level of endogenous miR-181b and MEV NS1 mRNAs from Ago2 or IgG immunoprecipitated lysates without transfection with the mimics. results showed that miR-181b, miR-181d and miR-301a were significantly decreased by almost 50% after MEV infection. expression of miR-181b was measured at times after MEV infection. qPCR was used to detect expression levels of miR-181b at 0 h, 6 h, 12 h, 24 h and 36 h after MEV infection. NS1 mRNA level was unaffected by either miR-181b mimics or inhibitors at 36 h post-transfection. the change of NS1 mRNA quantity level was too low to be detected. the miR-181b target site we predicted is identical in different MEV strains. miR-181b and miR-181d had 9 nucleotides, whereas miR-181c had 7. different base pairing structures between miR-181b and miR-181c in the NS1 target sit may be related to the function of miRNAs. cellular endogenous miR-181b inhibits replication of MEV in the F81 cell line by targeting the MEV NS1 mRNA coding region resulting in mRNA translational repression. results provide further insight into the mechanisms of MEV infection and may be useful in development of naturally-occurring miRNA antiviral strategies. TCID50 values were used to quantitate the effects of miR-181c and miR-181d mimics and inhibitors on viral growth curves in F81 cells. qPCR was used to assess the effects of miR-181c (B) and miR-181d (E) mimics and inhibitors on NS1 expression. 6 small RNA was an internal control. data are from 3 independent experiments (mean SD).
